comment._content:
A Yale man, was VP of Operations for the Pennsylvania railroad, according to this NY Times piece


:http://query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9C06E3DE1038E633A25752C1A9609C946496D6CF

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: William Wallace Atterbury (January 31, 1866 – September 20, 1935) was a Brigadier General during World War I. He was instrumental in reorganizing railroad traffic during the war for more efficient transportation of troops and supplies for the Allied forces. After the war, he became president of the Pennsylvania Railroad in 1925. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Wallace_Atterbury

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In the news in 1913 as a member of an arbitration board established under an act of Congress to mediate a threatened railway strike.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In the news in 1913 as a member of an arbitration board (with Seth Low, D. L. Cease, and others) established under an act of Congress to mediate a threatened railway strike.
